titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 1. V. Ride alone. symbols New road

list.item: Pleasonton Stephen. Light-house keepers— Dix
Brent Daniel— Despatches from W. Tudor

list.head:
Visits
Moore Son of the former
list.item: Moore of Va
Rush— Richard— Advertisement to pay loan of 1814

div.p: 2. V:30. Thursday. Ride the round

list.item:
Brent Daniel— Letter from A. Gallatin. Huygens.
Post with Superscription grand portage Canada.

list.head: Visits.
list.item: Hull of Louisiana
Wilson— John— his claim and papers
Hamilton. Major— Superintendent of penitentiary
Rush— Richard— Advertisement published—
Watkins Tobias. 3. Pamphlets 2 Letters from Baltimore.

div.p: 3. III.45— Friday

list.item: Graham— George— Letter from S. L. Gouverneur—indignant
Danforth— Clergymen from Pittsfield & Philadelphia—former Post
Clay Henry— Returned last Night.

list.head: Visits— returned from New-York
The Son arrived from Havre with Genl. Verveer—
list.item: Huygens— Bangeman.

div.p: 4. IV:30. Saturday.

list.item:
Graham— G. Letter &c from S. L. G— John Wilson’s claim.
Order for Sale of Lands in Florida 2d. Monday Jany 1829.
Miss of Bethlehem
Atkinson— Ellicott’s Mills
Wilson— John— his Claim—disallowed.

list.head: Visitors— Mr Jefferson’s published Letters, His opinions of Washington— Inconsistency

list.item: Nourse— C. J.— Letter from Genl. Porter to be here Thursday
Hay Charles— Mr Southard at Trenton— Erie ready for Sea
M’Claskey— James— of Detroit— Claims at the War Office
Rush— Richard— J. Wilsons claim
Hellen— T. J—
Committee of coloured people, for a burying ground.

div.p: 5. VI:15. Sunday.

list.item: Heard Mr Hawley— 1. Corinthians 1–7.8— Colossians 2.9.

div.p: 6. V:15. Ride Rockville road. symbols

list.head:
Letters from Mr Southard
Randall’s compn. 1500. wants an assistant Agent.

div.p: Order for discharge from prison of Adolph D. Latter in Vermont. Exor. for debt—
Order for discharge from prison of Benjamin Winslow Masstts. fraud on the Revenue—debt
Mr Clay’s opinion of Gouverneur.

list.item: Ringgold Tench.
Wise— Captain & Mrs.
Cocke— Mr of Va

list.head: Genl. Verveer’s daughter with him—here only for 2 or 3 days—

list.item:
Chalmers. of Ohio— for money to influence the election
drunk.

div.p: 7. IV:30. Ride— By S. H. Smith’s— back by Rockville Turnpike

list.item: Smith J. A.— Surgeon from Brazil symbols Born in Boston

list.head: Visits— Fullerton Member of Penna Senate and applicant for Office
Visits— Este his Son in Law’s A.
list.item: His Son.
Slade— Contradiction of Nagle’s lying Affidavit
Bulfinch. C— Returned from his Excursion— Pediment finished—
Gilmor, of Baltimore— Business at the Treasurer
Derrick— W. S— Letter from W. B. Rochester and Answer—
Brent. Daniel— Letter from C. Carroll— Grandson to be Midshipman
John and Charles, dined at Mr Vaughan’s

div.p: 8. IV. Ride back of Race ground

list.item: Baker— John M— R. Forrest died last Night

list.head: B. Harrison Candidate for Elector in Va

list.item: Post-Office at Maysville— M Langhorne
Clay— H. Papers from Jones Superintendent of Patent Office—

Wirt W. Returned from Summer Excursion— Election desperate.
C. J. Ingersoll, bird of passage—
Warrington. Come— Visit
Croghan Coll. from Tour of Inspection. Holton Plantation.

div.p: 9. IV— Ride. back of S. H. S— Rock Creek Church and Race ground

list.head: 50—for building a Methodist Church
list.item: Waters— Revd. of Alexa
Trumbull. John— Comes to save his pictures from moulding.
Thumlert. George— Measures for Shoes. His heritage
John, Charles and Abby—at Mr Huygens’s Ball

div.p: 10. IV:15. Ride to the Canal—

list.item: Nourse. C. J— Captain J. Rogers—furlough to go to France

list.head: Mr Monroe remitted Williams’s debt on Exon as Bail for another— Williams’s Claim on T. Ringgold

list.item:
Winters John—
Model for a Patent. Wants to borrow money—
Rush— Richard— Letter to the Mayor Gales— City Loan Agency
Southard— Samuel L.— returned— Distt. Judge— Pennsylvania

list.head: Visits— Montebello in Canada— Politics of Russia, France and Great Britain.

div.p: 11— III:45. Saturday.

list.item: Elgar. Burying ground for the People of Colour. 100
Rodgers— John— Recommends C. Pinkney, and Paulding
Roberdeau— Isaac— out of health
Simpson— an Irishman from Bedford County Pennsylvania.
Verveer— Genl— His Expedn. to Guatemala— Recommends C. Hughes
Echeson— from Montgomery County— Maryland— Visitor.

Rush— Richard— Letter from his brother Distt. judge— Letter from Collr.
Savannah. Act of Parliamt— Lead Mines— Illinois—

div.p: 12. IV:30. Walk, behind the College

list.item: Heard Mr Laird at 2d. Presbyterian Church. Philips1.21—
George Watkins and George Kremer here
Heard Mr Danforth. Isaiah 9.6.— Wonderful—

div.p: 13. IV. Monday— Ride to Bladensburg Spring.

list.item: Derrick W. S. Letter from R. Potter N.C. and Answer—
Leavenworth. Coll Loan for the State.
Trumbull John.
Approved a Resolution—dated 20. Septr. 1828 of the Corporation of Washington, to raise 10000 dollars by Lottery, for Schools, and a Town House—
Brevet promotion— Kane and papers—
Post-Office New-York.
Letter to M’Keehan and to A. Baring for Washington City Loan— Letter from Mayor Gales.
Letters from Genl. Scott— 23 and 25. Septr.
Court-Martial proceedings at West-Point
Captn. E. Mackay— 3. Arty.
Wants a place for her husband.
Going to-morrow— Recommends Burnet—
Has taken down his pictures— Proposes Curtains &c to preserve them.

div.p: 14. IV. Ride the round

list.item:
Clay— H. Baron Lederer— Letter from I. M’Kim— Peruvian decree.
Letter from Phelps. Convn baptists. Richards’s claim. Trist
Porter— Peter B. Furlough for Captn. M’Neil and Lieutt.

div.p: 15. IV:45. Wednesday. Ride over Eastern Branch Bridge— Race

list.item:
Hay— Charles. Waters Marshal of Florida— Negroes— Com. Barron to go
to the Pacific.
Simpson— the Bedford County Irishman, going—
Laird Revd. R. M. 25. Western Theological Seminary. Alleghany.
Slade— W. Note to C. Hughes—the Arbitration

div.p: 16 V:30— Ride to Georgetown First fires.

list.item: Graham— George.

list.head: visits
list.item: Watkins Tobias— twice
Cutler of Boston
Gill of Baltimore
Richards. George H— Claim to compn— Chief Clerk Treasy Dept
Lyon Dr. of Frederick, with Watkins.
Effect of frost on young trees
Black and English Walnuts.
Catalpa’s White Mulberries
Persimons— Box-elders.
Vines.
Buttons
Proclamation for Land Sales Augusta, Mississippi 4th. Monday Jany. 1829.
Comn. to Joseph Mechlin— Assistant Agent on the Coast of Africa—

div.p: 17. IV:30— Friday. Ride the round— White frost. 3d. day’s race—

list.item:
Hay— Charles Complaint agt. Waters Smith— C. C. Biddle’s Letter on
Breakwater— proposals for the Stone.
Jones P. A. J. P— Appeal from his trial and dismission—1821—
Brent Daniel— Complaint against Waters Smith gave Mr B. the papers
Armstrong Andrew. not gone to Lima— Peruvian Ordinance
Penhallow. Samuel— Midshipman resigned. Wants to be restored.
Derrick W. S— with Draft to Mr Vaughan—and other papers—
Clay— Henry— Letter to C. Vaughan— Burr’s affair— Jonn. Russell
Porter— Peter B— Genl. Scott’s pretensions— West-Point trial AEneas Mackay
Approved Sentence of Court-Martial, cashiering Lieutt. W. A Randolph—
Seneca Indian— U.S. Stocks.

div.p: 18: V:15— Saturday— Ride back of the forest. Last race.
Order for remission of the penalty in the case of the Ship Caravan, Abraham King—Master, for bringing an excess of 2 passengers from Havre to New-York— on paymt of Costs.
from Quincy—going to Old Point comfort—
Remarks on AEneas Mackay’s trial.
Power to receive dividends for Seneca’s.

list.item: Ringgold— T. Mrs Williams’s claim— To see the Comptroller
Jones Patent Office circulars— Alterations.
Ashmun of Baltimore— Full of electioneering.
Rush— Richard— Mr Mercer has obtained his loan
Ensign. of Masstts
Baker of Albany
Foy— John— Garden

div.p: 19. VI. Sunday.

list.item: Heard Mr Beasley A.M. from Proverbs— 1–5
Hawley P.M. from Matthew, 11.29.
Lambert— Genl— from Virginia— Stanton Spectator publication
Clay— Henry— Jonathan Russell’s new Telegraph publication—
Gales Joseph— jr— Read to him Letter to Giles in 1808

div.p: 20 IV Monday— Rain

list.item: Wallace of Baltimore and Alabama— Muscle Shoal Surveys
Derrick— Answer to Krudener’s Note with Declaration of War
Taylor— William— Consul to Vera Cruz— Returned from Maine
Clay— Henry— Baron Krudener’s Letter and answer

div.p: 21. IV:15. Tuesday— Ride before dinner with John— symbols

list.head: Mail contractors from Vermont— There are nearly 200 of them here—bidding and underbidding for all the contracts in New-England, for four years—
list.item: Pettis—
Derrick— W. S— with draught of Letter to Chevr Huygens— passage for General Verveer in Sloop of War, Erie Captn. Turner—to Curaçao—came to say he should introduce Mr Ternaux & another—

list.head: Mail contractors.

list.item: Ogden— Aaron— Coll. visitor.
Watkins— with Letter from Carte Blanche to Crawford
Macomb— Genl— AEneas Mackay’s Court-Martial— Scott’s claim
Ternaux— Commissioner of France to South-America
Miller— Hiram— Pensioner, lost a leg last War
Bracket Charles— Mail contractor from Vermont.
Thacher— Collector at Passamaquoddy.
Ride with John in the Woods— Mr Frye’s, Mrs Newman there.

div.p: 22. IV:30. Wednesday.

list.item: Hay Charles— Instructions to Captain Turner—Erie—Genl. Verveer
Anderson— Joseph— Mrs Williams’s claim— My Letter of Decr 1808 lost
Derrick W. S— answer to Vaughan— Delivery of Drummond’s Island.
Bartlett of New-Bedford— Mail contractor

list.head: Visitors. Mail contractors and Ladies
list.item: King.
Another
Two Ladies

Southard— S. L— The expedition to the South Sea— Missionary Periodical
and Letter from Lieutt. Percival.
Ride from 2:30 to 5. P.M— Gathered acorns. Black yet ripening— All picked up under the trees good for nothing Chesnut Oak Acorns sprouting.
Oyster Supper.

div.p: 23. V. Thursday— Ride round race ground—

list.head: Mail contractors visit.
list.item: Howard of Connt
Waterhouse of Maine
Scribner of Maine
Jones— Roger. twice— Books and Papers relating to Brevet rank—
Clay Henry. Chargé d’Affaires to Peru— E. Ingersoll—
Brent Daniel— Commission to Jos. Hopkinson— District Judge Phila
Porter— Peter B. Letter from Govr. Forsyth— Georgia Claims on Creeks.
Carroll— Charles— New-York Senator— visitor

list.head: Visitors— Mail Contractors

list.item: Cass— with Deputation of Winebagoes at New-York— Going to Boston—
Persico Luis— To take leave— Death of his father— Tympanum open—
Linnell of Barnstable Co. Contractor with Navy Board for Yellow Pine.
Company to dine Barrell, Cass, Cranch, Elliot, Fry, Hunt, Lamb, Persico Smith, Trumbull, Watkins—

div.p: 24. V:15. Friday. Ride through Georgetown—

list.item: Randolph— Ex-Lieutt. in the Marine Corps— Restitution

list.head: Visitors— Mail Carriage Horses travel from 10 to 15 Miles a day according to speed—for 4 years—worth from 80 to 100 dollars
list.item: Slade and
Ten Mail Contractors
Otto. John C.— Dr. Letter from J. Sergeant—
M’lean John— Postmaster— Smithville, New-York— Jesse H. Smith.
Rush— Richard—
Coll. Bankhead and Major Paine—employed on the Florida claimants for damages— Their compensation— Genl Scotts claim to command Macomb—
Power to H. Clay to conclude a Treaty of Commerce with the Austrian Consul General Baron Lederer—
Approved Sentence of Court-Martial at West Point, dismissing Cadet Thomas T. Henderson, for neglect of duty and breach of arrest 10. Octr 1828

div.p: 25. V. Saturday. Ride—came out in S. H. Smith’s— Tympanum

list.item: Chase Samuel— judge— a friendly visit

list.head: Recommended by D. J. Pearce for light-house keeper Nayat Point, R.I
list.item: Mentor of Ohio.

Wirt— William— Opinion upon A. Armstrong’s bonds as Navy
Agent. S. L. Gouverneur & N.Y. Post-Office
T. J. Hellen to dine
Heard A. Bigelow— 2. Corinthians 13.7.

Stranger for Hawley 21. after Trinity— Luke 8.18. Take heed
how ye hear.
Mr. and Mrs Newman and Mr Frye here.

div.p:
27. IV:30.— Ride— Willow Oak Acorns— Good black-Oak
falling from their cups.

list.head: 20— Contribution for building a Roman Catholic Church in Butler Co. Pennsylvania

list.item:
Handy Election of Pastor 2d. Presbyterian Church Campbell
and Danforth.

list.head: Italians— Raggi complains of Assault & Battery—

list.item: Lynch— T. B. Letter from C. King— To be Chaplain in the Navy
Merrick of Maine— Nephew to J. Vaughan— Engineer
Mr Campbell voted Pastor of Presbn Church—
. . . . Elliot married.

list.head: Visitors— Eden comes to the U.S. to remove the bones of his Grandfather once Governor of Maryland—buried at Annapolis.
list.item: Wirt— William—
Bailey—

Gales— Joseph jr.— W. B. Giles denies having written Letters
to me, or received Letters from me in 1808–9.

div.p: 28. V. Ride— Pin black and black Oak Acorns

list.item: Southard S. L. Waters Smith’s claim— Detention of Sloop Erie

Fullerton— Going for Pennsylvania to-morrow— Penitentiary
Superintendency

list.head: Agents for Columbia College— Fair prospects of desperate Circumstances— paying off small debts.

list.item: Clay— H. Jonathan Russell’s disclosures.
Jones— Roger— Register of Commissions— defective— Brevets
Smith— A Slave indemnity claim

div.p: 29. IV:45. Ride Rockville road— Fall of the leaf.

list.item: Lynch Solicits the appointment of Chaplain.

list.head: Clerk in the Treasury Department—said he should not forget me—his friend from Pennsylvania

list.item: Wells— Benjn.— a claimant as collector of direct tax in 1800—
Clark. W. Treasurer. Going on a visit to Pennsylvania

list.head: Dr. Selden from Loudoun County— Says Mr. Monroe was hurt last Friday by a fall of his horse—
District Attorney— Spoke of Waters Smith’s claim for maintaining negroes—

list.item: Secret Journals of Old Congress.
Nourse— C. J— brought me papers relating to Genl. Scott’s claim.

list.head: Surgeon General introduced his uncle, a resident of Boston— Presbyterian Church schism— Campbell elected

list.item: Roberdeau Isaac Has been unwell— Astronomical observation James Graham’s quadrature of the circle
Jones— Roger Coll.— Brevet papers
Porter Peter B. Letter from Izzard— Read me draft to Scott.
T. B. Adams departed for Fortress Monroe.
The School of Artillery practice to be broken up.
Black Oak Acorns falling.

div.p: 30. IV:15. Ride to Georgetown— Acorns falling— Boy

list.item: Graham— J. E. Urgent Letter for a place
Clay— Henry. New draft of Letter to Krudener— Jonn. Russell’s treachery to his confidence— Baron Lederer
Brent— Daniel Documents and Journals of last Session— not ready
Smith— Waters— Mitchel’s complaint against him. Key-West negroes—
Nourse— C. J— Brevet rank papers. Commissions and pamphlets—

list.head: A visitor from Vermont. William Cooper’s Affidavit that he attended at a Lodge with me. Pittsfield, March 1819.
list.item: Fletcher.
Jones— Coll. Roger— His Brevet Commissions— No Copies at his Office—
Southard— S. L. Barron to command Squadron in the Pacific. Southard’s publications

Trumbull John. Evening— Edward 1. in Wax. Trumbull’s pictures
Judge W. Johnson’s confidential Letters to Mr Clay.

div.p: 31. IV:45. Ride the round

list.head: the Comptroller and his Son

list.item: Brent. Daniel— Sloane said to be elected in Ohio.
Smith— Waters— Dr Hall’s petition— Mitchel’s Case of the Negroes

list.head:
Richardson—visitor from Baltimore
Order on A. Armstrong’s Bond

list.item: Southard Saml. L— Barron to command Squadron in the symbols pacific— Stewart to be Chaplain
